APETIT.HE.summary: Apetit Oyj operates as a food company primarily in Finland, Norway, Germany, Sweden, and internationally. It operates through Food Solutions, Oilseed Products, and Grain Trade segments. The company develops, produces, and sells frozen foods, such as frozen vegetables and ready meals, and ready-to-use vegetables under the Apetit brand name; and offers fish based products, burgers, nuggets, granites, arctic peas, and frozen pizzas. It also supplies frozen foods and fresh products, as well as manufactures various products for private labels. In addition, the company produces and sells vegetable and rapeseed oils, oilseeds, and raw materials for feeds; and trades in grains, oilseeds, and raw materials for feeds. It serves food industry companies, retailers, and professional food service sectors, as well as the hotel, restaurant, and catering sector. The company was founded in 1930 and is headquartered in Helsinki, Finland.

ATRAV.HE.summary: Atria Oyj, together with its subsidiaries, manufactures and markets meat and food products in Finland, the Nordic countries, Russia, and Estonia. The company provides fresh and consumer packed meat; poultry products; cooking products, such as sausages; cold cuts and spreads; convenience food; animal feed; and vegetable and delicatessen products. It offers its products under the Atria, Sibylla, 3-Stjernet, Aalbaek, Maks & Moorits, VK, WÃµro, Pit-Product, CampoMos, and Casademont brand names. The company markets its products to grocery trade, food service, export, and concept customers, as well as food industry. Atria Oyj was founded in 1903 and is headquartered in SeinÃ¤joki, Finland.

FODELIA.HE.summary: Fodelia Oyj operates as a food company. The company offers crispy potato chips and additive-free corn snacks to retail stores and central wholesale businesses in Finland, as well as importers and retail stores in export target countries. It also provides Feelia, a pre-cooked meal for various clients, including municipalities, care companies, lunch restaurants, central wholesale businesses, wholesalers, and households. Fodelia Oyj was founded in 1979 and is based in PyhÃ¤ntÃ¤, Finland.

HK4.SG.summary: HKScan Oyj produces, markets, and sells pork, beef, poultry and lamb products, processed meats, and convenience foods to the retail, food service, industrial, and export sectors in Finland, Sweden, Denmark, and the Baltics. The company primarily sells its products under the HK, Scan, Rakvere, PÃ¤rsons, Kariniemen, Via, Rose, and Tallegg brands. It also exports its products to approximately 50 countries. The company was founded in 1913 and is headquartered in Turku, Finland. HKScan Oyj is a subsidiary of LSO Osuuskunta.

The company primarily sells its products under the HK, Scan, Rakvere, PÃ¤rsons, Kariniemen, Via, Rose, and Tallegg brands. It also exports its products to approximately 50 countries. The company was founded in 1913 and is headquartered in Turku, Finland. HKScan Oyj is a subsidiary of LSO Osuuskunta.

RAIKV.HE.summary: Raisio plc, together with its subsidiaries, produces and sells food and fish feeds primarily in Finland, the United Kingdom, Poland, Ireland, and Belgium. The company operates through three segments: Healthy Food, Healthy Ingredients, and Other Operations. The company engages in the production, procurement, and supply of grain-based foods and their ingredients for industrial and catering companies, as well as fish feed under the Benecol, Elovena, Sunnuntai, Nalle, Torino, Provena, Nordic, Benella, Hercules, Baltic Blend, and Raisio Oats brands. It is also involved in the rental and royalty activities. The company was formerly known as Raisio Group plc and changed its name to Raisio plc in 2005. Raisio plc was founded in 1939 and is headquartered in Raisio, Finland.
